Module com.jlbabilino.json
Package com.jlbabilino.json

Class JSONObject

java.lang.Object
com.jlbabilino.json.JSONEntry
com.jlbabilino.json.JSONObject
public class JSONObject extends JSONEntry
This class represents a JSON object type. It contains key-value pairs where the key is a String, and the value is a JSONEntry. It implements a Map to achieve this. If a program creates JSON data manually (rather than from serialization), then the map used to construct the JSONObject will not be exposed to other classes directly in any way, and it will not modify the map, but it will access methods in it. This means that modifications to the map WILL AFFECT this object. Please try to keep the map used for construction hidden from other classes after it is instantiated with the appropriate data.

  • Method Details

    • get

      public JSONEntry get​(String key) throws JSONKeyNotFoundException
      Retrieves the mapped JSONEntry from the given String key, if it is availible. A key is availible if and only if containsKey() returns true.
      Parameters:
      key - the String key used to retrieve the value
      Returns:
      the JSONEntry associated with the key provided
      Throws:
      JSONKeyNotFoundException - if the key does not exist in the object

    • containsKey

      Checks if a string key contains a mapping in this JSON object.
      Parameters:
      key - the key to check for
      Returns:
      true if and only if the key exists in this object

    • isEmpty

      public boolean isEmpty()
      Returns true if and only if there are no key-value mappings in this JSON object. The return value of this method is identical to size() == 0.
      Returns:
      true if and only if there are no key-value mappings in this JSON object

    • toJSONText

      public String toJSONText​(int indentLevel, int jsonFormat)
      Generates a String that represents this JSON object. Creates curly braces around the object, and places all key-value pairs in random order, separated by commas. For example, some JSON object could be represented as

      "{"entry": [9, 10], "hi": null, "json": true}"

      Format options are availible for this method. There are three options that will affect the result of this method:

      1. indentLevel: This tells the method which indent level the object is beginning on. For example, if this were the root JSON entry, then the indent level would be 0. If this object were a value associated with a key in a JSON object that were the root of the JSON, then the indent level would be 1 because it is one level inside the JSON.
      2. indentSpaces
      3. objectNewlinePerItem
      4. objectBeginOnNewline
      Specified by:
      toJSONText in class JSONEntry
      Parameters:
      indentLevel - the indent level of the object declaration ({)
      jsonFormat - formatting options
      Returns:
      the string representation of this JSON object
